number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 23, 2013
Early Access Review
								Basically a 3rd person space flight simulator, but with some very interesting twists. Most notabely the ability to design your own space ship, designs which NPC's are known to use as well, to keep the playing field balanced.Add to that relational status with numerous factions and reasonably large universe (can be set upon creating one) and you have yourself a great arena to test these designs in. Don't have an enemy? Create one by just randomly shooting ships that happen to pass by. You could always go mining or salvaging derelict craft for resources as well.Great graphics and awesome soundtrack, easy to learn controls, but sometimes not so clear on what, though optional, you mission objectives are make this a nice addition to any collection.There are some problems though, crashes, editor that has trouble doing certain things, but nothing really game breaking. And although I'm not much of a multiplayer gamer, I can see some real potential in that latest addition as well.Bare in mind though that this is still an project in development.

Early Access Review
								DON'T  BUY THIS GAME RIGHT NOW!!!Even than the core idea seems interesting, the game is in so early development phase that there is no fun of any kind.The key feature of this game is the possibility of to design and to build your own customized ship from scratch.Other key feature is the randomization of galaxies but, it seems you have nothing to do with planets, there is no interaction.Engine is a hard CPU consuming and doesn't seem to be optimized.Lot of hours flying in a void space, where nothing happens.Lack of history board, or goals or missions.No user's manual. No key bindings. Weak user interface.Map does nothing for you. You never know where your ship is and, which is the distance to any potential target (except if they are in your range).Making it short, this 'game' needs a HUGE effort before it can be called a game.

content:

												Basically this game is the Space Stage from Spore* combined with Freelancer-typish free universe.*(as in: you browse the internet for cool looking ships other people have made and then download them)You can fly the Ebon Hawk (SW: KOTOR 1 & 2), the SSV Normandy (Mass Effect -trilogy) or the USG Ishimura (Dead Space). Or X-Wings.Controls are pretty basic and easy to pick up and the graphics look nice, except the "Space" is just a huge colorful cloud, instead of a starry sky.

								First of all, this review covers the game in its current state (D14.2)When I first started up the game all I got was audio na dno visuals...After looking through forums I found this was common for Macs and has been happening for quite a while...A major bug that should have been fixed ages ago. number of helpful: 4 of 10 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 18, 2014
Early Access Review
								With the knowledge that it is an early access game, I am going to hold my tongue, or fingers a little. While I love space sims especially with that sandbox aspect I have a few complaints.I started a career mode game so I could try it out. I hadn't played the game in a few months and wanted to see what was new... Not much was for starters, but that is to be expected, a lot of Early Access games don't have a lot of updates (Except for something like Space Engineers ). I picked the random parts and started building my ship. After 1 and a half hours of fumbling around both because of player error, and because its a little weird... I press launch only to have to put in subsystems. (no I couldn't read the tutorial, the UI freaked out and overlapped the words) Once I figure (sortof) that out, I launch it... The game loads, and within 5 seconds.. not anymore or any less, I was destroyed... So I tried again... and again... Only to end with the same result. Then I go to the main menu, and decide to try and load a 65 part ship from my workshop... It loaded, and a warning popped up saying that I had to many parts and it might crash... 65 parts, and I hadn't even added the big shiny hanger doors and millions of hanger control modules I wanted to.. So I decided to launch it (and after some more subsystem fumbling) got it launched. I fought off the army outside, and then got up to my max speed of 57. In space. In a simulation game. Then I look at the directory, and find out if I press T and turn off a shield thing that stops me I will go faster... So a top speed of 83. Way to go for the USS Gweepo... A new speed Record. Then I point it towards the nearest planet hoping I will be able to use the new mining laser thing I put on to mine stuff off the planet. I watch as the numbers slowly decrease from 202.1 to 202 to 201.9 and so on. After seeing that I did the only sensible thing. Tried to warp towards the planet... Only to warp into it. Ten minutes later I spawn again and warp (correctly luckily) to the planet and try and land on it. Only to die again.Overall, I think this game CAN have potential if the devs iron out the bugs that it has. They (he\she\it, I dunno) seem to be very interested in te steam community so I give them points just for that.. Also, collision, and speed especially when it says that if you press the "T" key it activates Newtonian flight, should mean I have a fixed acceleration, up to an infinite speed. Not just a faster speed. Big ships need a boost, the AI needs help, Weapons need balancing, People need a little breathing room at spawn. Along with that comes the good stuff about it. You can (at the risk of crashing) build masive ships that destroy entire fleets (it was fun, until the game engine died) You can also build little fighters that reach 800 (units of speed and distance needed) While it may not be the #1 space sim on my wish list (Limit Theory is so awesome :3 ) It has a fighting chance. I can't wait to see what comes of it!

												The reports here are crazy. It seemed to me that the community got spoiled from DEV interaction that they expected the world. I haven't played this since it's pre beta phase but what i noticed is this. Not only can you make just about any ship you can imagine but any ship you make will be ingame flown by npc's. So what i did is subscribed to about 300+ player made ships and guess what... some how they are floating around in the game world. You can decide how large/ how many star systems/ factions are in your game at the start, as well as do missions for them. but this seems like if your dream is to not be limited by developer made ships you can fight any number of different space battles.I just wish they added the ability to buy/sell full ships in the store. That way someone who was playing the regular mode without infinite money and parts could save up enough to buy one of the ships on the steam work shop or even a generic basic ship without having to make every detail. That could make the economy more interesting as well.

content:
Posted: December 4, 2014
												I would definitely recommend Kinetic Void, however with a warning. The game as it is, is a lot of fun in my opinion. The ship building aspect is very entertaining and allows players to create whatever sort of ship they please, from small one-man fighters to giant hulking cruisers. Once out in space the game can get a little empty. There are missions to do which give you an immediate objective or you can go out and sort of do your own thing. There is mining for resources and diplomacy which allows you to go into a hostile system and hunt enemy ships for bounties. It can get a little old though. In my opinion, more diverse missions should be added as well as an option to select mission based on what kind of playstyle you have (maybe a mission interface at space stations?). This would allow players who want to play as a pirate to do raid missions, miners to do resource gathering, etc... I also think smaller stations should be implemented that do not have shipyards, but rather some sort of other funtions (ie. Smugglers' dens, military instalations, trade centers, etc?).  One more thing I would hope to see is more interaction with friendly faction ships, because as of now, friendlies just sort of drift around space and don't do much. I'd like to see something like, escort missions for friendly factions, or the possibility of hiring wingmen to fly around with you and assist in combat.I think the game is deifitely on the right track, it IS a fun game as is but it still needs some work, I hope a DEV gets the chance to read this review and think about the suggestions I've made. I think implementing  some of them would make the game feel fuller once the fun of ship building wears out or you've run out of ship ideas.

								Frankly I don’t know where to start, this game is such a mess, the entire thing is awkward and amateurish, easily the worst early access title I have seen, even having bought it at -75% I feel cheated. number of helpful: 1 of 4 people (25%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 25, 2014
Early Access Review
								Even for an early access game Kinetic Void offers solid game play with consitant updates by the developers. I've spent most of the time just building different ships in the game. The amount of detail allowed in customizing the ship can be staggering. You place hull parts and engines, fill those with subsystems that affect the ship in different ways. Currently you can take it out and fly around, shoot other ships or mine. There are also factions in game that you can do missions for that are generated for you as you are out in space. Newtonian physics as an option adds a great layer to the flight. Nothing better than strafing around at high speeds while in a dog fight. At this stage I can whole heartedly recommend this purchase, especially with devs that respond to the community.

content:
Posted: February 24, 2015
												Yes - the updates are slow. Yes - the dev team is small.No, this isn't a scam. I enjoy this game immensely just for the shipyard alone, and while the rest of the game (missions, general combat, etc...) are still young, and incomplete - the potential is there, but we, as gamers need to support it and the devs. If you ever enjoyed building your own ships in other games - or wanted too, KV is a GREAT GREAT way to spend hours and hours placing parts, balancing subsystems and then blasting other ships into pieces in sometimes, EPIC battles.No, you will not have a completed game if you buy this within the next few months; or even anytime this year - but it is getting there. Every month or so, a new update fixes bugs, adds features, and improves the general playability of the game. Just give it time, and it could be the next Minecraft. Years in alpha/beta; and then BAM it just gets glorious!

number of helpful: 4 of 11 people (36%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 10, 2015
												This is the only game I have ever played that has a warp drive of sorts (except star trek online). You can build your own ships from scratch, and make truly any design you desire. NPCs will also have these ships available, meaning you can give them ships that equal your own in terms of power (so the game changes as you become more inventive). It is tricky to manage the subsystems along with the space of the ship, but once you know what you're doing everything should be fineThe worst thing about this game would have to be...the repetitiveness of placing weapons. You have to select your turret each time, and place it so it looks right. The mirroring isn't as finely tuned as the mirroring in Kerbal Space Program. Additionally, once the turret is down you must go into the weapons subsystem and select what each individual turret should be equiped with. Making large ships with lots of subsystems can get tedious and/or confusing, especially if you want everything to look even (which I do).A good point, the galactic relations allow you to make enemies and allies, which can be fun. Trading is something that I haven't yet figured out, which leads me to believe that it's poorly explained, however overall this is a fun game if you want to build your own ships and fight others in space.The main thing that would make this game a massive improvement would be multiplayer, better controls, better graphics, simpler mechanics to build ships, and getting rid of a few mission scripts that don't work.

number of helpful: 1 of 5 people (20%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 15, 2014
Early Access Review
								We've all had that dream (or, at least most of us) to be the best space captain in the whole galaxy, Taking down bandits and pirates, exploring, and helping out other ships in need. --but..--Unfortunatly, Kinetic Void lacks in the killing pirates and the whole "clan" thing and even the captain thing. There is no communication with these clans. You can't command your crew at all. The only thing to do is to explore, and shoot ships aimlessly.--but...--Thats not to say that this game isn't fun. This game is extremly fun, I don't mind what you are limited to do as of now. the galaxy is beautiful and exploring is actually pretty fun. But my all time favorite part is the ship building. Easy, fun, and complex. I could spend all day just making different ships. that's the best part.--I do realize this is in development, I'm writing this for as is. But, In the end, Kinectic Void is a great game. Every update is awesome, leaves you wanting more. If they add muiltiplayer this game will get even bigger, can't wait for the next update!

number of helpful: 1 of 5 people (20%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 20, 2014
Early Access Review
								Kinetic Void is a very Early Alpha game. A few annoying bugs and glitches which hopefully get fixed sooner rather than later. The ship building is amazing. despite the bug and glitches. It is fantastic. Easily the best part of the game with me. Space flight is not too bad. I think as and when future updates come out then it will improve. Right now you just fly around shooting stuff, mining asteroids, selling the ores and building bigger better ships. Would like to see the planned economy come out. That should improve the gameplay a lot, Would also like to see the ability to start a factions, take space stations, mining stations, claim systems, Have NPC ships fly around the galaxy mining, and defending territory.Performance of the game is very good. On High end hardware the game runs over 110 FPS on maxmimum settings.  Graphics are very good in most places. In some places like the engine trails, they are pretty poor, at least to myself.Should you buy this game? In my opinion yes. While right now there are bugs and glitches, which is to be expected in an early alpha game, The future looks bright, with the developers looking well into the future with possible multiplayer and DLC content.

restart your entire ship, bug bugs and oh look, more BUGS, and heven forbid, i do not want to see anything passed the building menu. but not the entire update is a mess up, they now have paint styles and even if the menu for ship building is so far gone and messed up, it has this professional look to it and just screams Si:Fi, and the creativity is real good, i can spend hours on it and the part where you finaly fly your ship out of dock and test it, makes you feel like a boss, cause normal, if you are on creative, it owns (a good suggestion when its your first time, play on creative) and having hardpoints that are animmated, and watching them activate, makes me want to just imagin one day having multiplayer and jumping and and being the capital ship of a huge fleet in the middle of a war.even IF they messed up D12 and i losed some faith in this game, it could most likely recover, i just hope they recover before people lose hope for this game entirely,this game is great and i am willing to forgive the game and the devs for the D12 update, (only if they dont mess D13 up like they did with D12) but for a suggestion, wait a little while, or get this when its on sale, dont get it at full price right now, cause this game is sitting on the edge of a deep hole, and if the devs dont get it together and work on the menu, then this game could lose its fans, butanyway i give the game, 6.48/10 steam stamps (thats my rating system: steam stamps)Edit:Now, i would like to say, that, dear Devs, you made D13 one of the best updates.Building Is WAY more responsive plus, with all the new tools that i just found, they allow you to do New things, like the one tool (i forgot its name) allows the player to move one part into another, Allowing for some rather good Ships, myself included. so, i have gained all my hope back thanks to the devs fixing the things that where wrong in D12, and overhauling the entire game with D13, so, if you are reading this, and you have not bought the game, then i would call you crazy to click off the page and not buy it, but before you do buy it (unless you want to show your support) wait till muiltplayer come out.i re-rate this game 8.8/10 steam stamps (like i said before, i rating system)(additional: if you want me to rate a game, PM me)Edit #2 (Final)This game has gone to a whole new level of epic with D14.2 just because of the fact that now i can basicly hover right over a planet, go as about 30 meters from the ground without being blowen up, but there are somethings that could be impermented to make this game better, first off, landing gears, to land on a planet, second, just maybe, add someway of exploring a planet, with a vehicle or running around on the planets. there are alot of things that could be added, but those twos where the first things that came to mind.(if you want the review, read that part the other parts just not this edit)

number of helpful: 0 of 3 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 8, 2014
Early Access Review
								Not entirely a waste of money.Pros:  ~ More intricate ship building: Less blocky designs, more artistic designs seem to be possible with this game. ~ More customization ~ Factions present, hostile and non-hostile. ~ Pretty good graphics, and runs very well. (Have not tested FPS with large ship builds yet, will do later.) ~ Vast space system.Cons: ~ Guide and tutorial needs work. Bigger font size. Different color than the rest of the screen, make it big and bold etc, otherwise players are going to ignore it at first (like I did) and then kick themselves later for ignoring it. It took me 10 minutes to locate the information needed to simply apply Subsystems. If it takes that long for an average player to deduce that, interest will wane quickly.Y'know, honestly... I was going to write a negative review...but while writing this piece I've had a chance to reflect upon the game itself. Right now it IS indeed worth the price. $20.00 USD for a Beta isn't too bad at all, especially given the wealth of content in game, not to mention the very awesome ship builder thing (once you get the hang of it).For anyone thinking of buying this game.... be warned its not your garden variety Minecraft-esque Ship Building game. It takes some thought and a bit of patience to learn how to build a ship, how to make it fly etc etc. Its not easy, but it is rewarding once you've mastered how the game works.Right now I'd give the game a 6/10. Its above average, but I'd like to come back and review it when its out of Early-Access / Beta etc.

content:
Posted: June 10, 2014
Early Access Review
								Delivers on all the very worst tedium of a 4X game with almost none of the freedom or wonder.  The generated universes are very featureless and bland.  The combat is a snorefest.  A sad skeleton of a game built backwards from the ceiling down.  There's a neat ship creation system but with nothing compelling for you to do with the ships you create, it's utterly pointless.The only entertainment I can find anyone having with the game thus far is creating ships with the generator and then posting them on the workshop.  Consider the game LEGO with spaceship parts, then.I'm sure this review will get thumbs-downed like nuts from a bunch of apologists who would recommend the game to you on the basis of what it could be and not what it actually is.  Anyone who would recommend this game to their friends based on its current state is a poor friend to have.

content:
Posted: October 15, 2014
Early Access Review
								I really don't understand the design of this game. I liked the concept of it enough to buy it (obviously) but when I gave it a try found that it lacked well, a lot. Its not just the fact that this game is in alpha, its that it has an amazingly bad interface and control scheme, bad graphics and sound, and sub-zero immersion factor. Its like this is a ship building tool with a few minor non-ship building features. The ships look and fly like toys. There is no sense of flying a technical marvel of space travel, it just feels like you are taking your cardboard box out for a spin in the driveway. Let me put it this way, if Steam let me try this before buying, I would not have purchased it. My advise to the devs, play a few space games like Freespace, or EVE Online or Privateer or Indepence War or something then take a long hard look at Kinetic Void and make some much needed changes. Frankly I am shocked that anyone can even play this game is its current form. Kudos to you who find something of value in this game but it makes me wonder if any of you have played other space games.

content:
Posted: March 7, 2014
Early Access Review
								Hi, I thought this game looked cool so I bought it. The initial part, the ship builder, was amazingly designed, only a tad confusing. After I created the ship, however, it spawned me in a galaxy. The flight controls were very confusing, and it would be nice to have a shipbuilding and flight tutorial added somewhere within the game to be easily accessed. Anyway, I pressed a wrong button and my ship exploded. Every time after that, my ship exploded. I have talked to the developer, Kaypix, and he says that all you have to do is create a new galaxy. Please don't get frustrated like I did. If you don't know what to do, Google will be your best friend, as well as amazing developers like Kaypix. I had a negative review, but I have changed my opinion. Buy this advanced game, but be sure you know exactly what you want when you get it, as the controls are confusing. Thanks again for your time.-MCMayhem

content:
Posted: June 27, 2013
												EDIT: The game is out of Early Access now. For me, I encounter a game breaking graphical bug (Linux specific) that is unlikely to be fixed. Unfortunately, as I cannot play it, I cannot recommend the game any more. In addition, the gameplay has been changed from what I prefered, with Newtonian-ish physics only present when your shields are down, making it near useless for combat.This game allows the player to build their own ship of any size and design (unless if you don't pick creative mode, in which case you will have to earn your parts), fly it anywhere in a massive procedurally generated galaxy, and interact with other factions along the way. The ultimate in futuristic space simulation.This is an early access game and is currently in an early alpha, with frequent updates.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: October 3, 2014
												Fun game, great developer.  I can't recommend the game in its current state unless you really want to fund development.Not gonna try to sell a game on hype and 'potential', especially after StarForge's debacle.  However, unlike CodeHatch, Badland Studios is very open, communicative, and engages with their community.So, yeah. It's not done yet, and won't be for a long while, but it's heading in a good direction, and it's already fun to just build the ships in the hangar.  Being able to take them out and fight with them is a bonus.  Worth twenty bucks? Not yet, but check back in a few months.Edit: Well, I was wrong!  It's 'done', but the developers are still planning to add more content.  Can't ask for much more than that, can ya?  Gonna be redoing my review later after I play it a bit.Edit 2: It's done..and..there's been no more content.  Not in any meaningful sense. I'm sad, but not disheartened.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 15, 2014
												I cannot recommend this game. They broke it. It used to be great - a sandbox experience where you could create any ship you wished, drag the file around in the directories, set up custom factions, create an entire universe with it's own factions, each with it's own style of ship (designed by you) and it's own alleigances / hostilities. Yeah. Not anymore. Now it's a dull, repetative, REALLY slow space game where by you need to mine ore, salvage ships and trade in a dull flying sim to make credits and upgrade your ship. Creating custom faction folders just causes a game crash now. The ship builder has a bunch of dumb restrictions that seriously limits the game's potential. Save your money. Man I wish I could go back to an older version.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: October 3, 2014
												Fun game, great developer.  I can't recommend the game in its current state unless you really want to fund development.Not gonna try to sell a game on hype and 'potential', especially after StarForge's debacle.  However, unlike CodeHatch, Badland Studios is very open, communicative, and engages with their community.So, yeah. It's not done yet, and won't be for a long while, but it's heading in a good direction, and it's already fun to just build the ships in the hangar.  Being able to take them out and fight with them is a bonus.  Worth twenty bucks? Not yet, but check back in a few months.Edit: Well, I was wrong!  It's 'done', but the developers are still planning to add more content.  Can't ask for much more than that, can ya?  Gonna be redoing my review later after I play it a bit.Edit 2: It's done..and..there's been no more content.  Not in any meaningful sense. I'm sad, but not disheartened.

Posted: June 27, 2013
												EDIT: The game is out of Early Access now. For me, I encounter a game breaking graphical bug (Linux specific) that is unlikely to be fixed. Unfortunately, as I cannot play it, I cannot recommend the game any more. In addition, the gameplay has been changed from what I prefered, with Newtonian-ish physics only present when your shields are down, making it near useless for combat.This game allows the player to build their own ship of any size and design (unless if you don't pick creative mode, in which case you will have to earn your parts), fly it anywhere in a massive procedurally generated galaxy, and interact with other factions along the way. The ultimate in futuristic space simulation.This is an early access game and is currently in an early alpha, with frequent updates.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 9, 2016
												This game is under developed, flawed, and broken. Frankly, it's gone from bad to worse through it's development. They throw out working systems in favor of new ones that introduce bugs that years later still arnt fixed, the UI makes no sense, the most interesting aspect, building is now horribly flawed and broken with menues that dont work properly, controls that dont always work or do what you tell them. Once you get out of the hangar and into the game, it dumps you into a universe that has no direction, with obscure and unintuitive controls. I would give this game a solid 3/10 for being a neat concept, but being executed horribly. Maybe another +1 for the decent soundtrack which is rather nice, but that's about all they did well.Going on their forums is little help too. The community is full of immaturity since any problem you bring up with is met with "L2P noob" and other snide comments when you bring up questions like "Why did symetry stop working" or "What is that horrible constant scratching noise that wont go away?"There are far better sandbox space games out there, dont waste your time or money.

content:
Posted: March 12, 2016
												I bought this game when it launched. It has not improved since it was launched on Early Access, if anything the updates made the 'game' worse. What's now worse is that the game is abandonware and hasn't been updated once in fourteen months. The game is riddled with bugs and glitches. The only redeeming quality is the music, which was outsourced to Artem (I believe) and can be Googled without buying this trash. AVOID. Wish I could get my money back. Too many developers these days take your money promising the world, then after months of excuses, run off with your money. Steam won't refund anything past 14 days so you're screwed really. Out of a good number of EA titles I've bought, only one (Project Zomboid) has been a success and hasn't robbed me.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: September 5, 2014
												Let's compare my first review to that of my current, shall we? Just about 0% of this game's previous playerbase now still has anything positive to say about this game, so my voice is just a drop in the bucket... But I realized I needed to edit this.- - - - - (Old Review) - - - - -This game is amazing. Hands down the most fun in a space game I've had in a long time.What I like about it is the sheer massiveness of the things you can create and the massiveness of the galaxies you can explore.I've also found out that you can create your own factions, and if you wanted to, delete the starters and make all custom ones that have their own unique ships and all.If you're into space or large-scale wars or both, look into it. It won't disappoint.- - - - - (New Review) - - - - -The game has been dead since January 2015. The developer, "Badlands Studios," is now some stupid game retail store somewhere in the US, owned by "LumberingTroll" (aka Sean Pollman) I suppose... But it's been almost a year since last I even looked at this game's page.Let's pray that these developers never live this embarrassment down - no group of coders who took advantage of hopeful fans so disgustingly should ever create games again. They released a massive list of planned features they intended to implement before suddenly (disregarding? ignoring? re-writing?) this list and passing their half-baked - no, too kind - utterly broken and pathetic project of a game as "complete" and then abandoning it after two or three further bug-fixing updates. ...which didn't even scratch the surface of what all was wrong with it. They took their money and split. Never in my life have I felt so horribly cheated, and it was only what, $20?I couldn't sit and let my once-positive review sit and be seen by other poor folk... So, here it is, over a year later. If anyone else ever sees this, you be sure and avoid any game that has Sean Pollman or "LumberingTroll" and friends listed as developers. You'll thank me later.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 16, 2014
												This was way before, I forgot I even reviewed this, new review on bottom.==================================================================================FIRST REVIEW==================================================================================================I don't have a whole lot of time put in this game but I can say that the game is worth the money.<<WILL UPDATE AS GAME PROGRESSES!!>>Pros:--Customization: Create and command ships of your very making or download one of the many on the workshop and cause havoc. Also if you manipulate the game files you can have your created ships be specific to factions.--Open Ended: Do what you want, when you want. No forced actions.--Beautiful environment.--Balanced Ships (Can't create an ultimate fighter with world destroying guns)--ACTIVE DEV TEAM! these guys are great and are always making updates to the game. They will listen to the community.Cons:--Should've stayed in early access a little longer still a few bugs here and there, but then again what new release game nowadays doesn't?--Kinda empty: for a sci-fi space sim it seems kinda empty.--No tutorial.In all the game has potential to be the best space sim out there but yes it still has some stuff needed.=================================================================================NEW REVIEW=================================================================================================As you can see the game had potential, then the devs took the money and ran (and still has the game up on the market)DO NOT BUY - DEAD GAME
